item.title: Report E-2023100251
item.description:
Report E-2023100251

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-12T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: OLEAN
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XON experienced a UN2693 Sodium Bisulfite Solution 40% release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a gouge in the top of the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into (2) 275-gallon poly totes. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with impacted absorbents into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100305
item.description:
Report E-2023100305

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-14T00:31:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: SCHENECTADY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 9/28/2023 a Veolia employee unloading drums from a truck into another trailer at the Veolia, Schenectady, NY 10 day intransit facility when the employee noticed that a 14 gallon fiber drum was stained and damp. The 14 gallon drum contained a 2.5 gallon glass bottle of Formic Acid With Not Less Than 5% But Less Than 10% Acid By Mass corrosive liquids. The outer container was opened and the inner container was inspected and was found to be broken and released its contents. No liquid was released from the outer packaging drum. The 14 gallon drum containing the broken glass bottle was overpacked into an 30 gallon 1H2 drum and transportation to the ultimate disposal facility was continued. The drum did not leak any amount of the corrosive liquid solution out of the outer container.

item.title: Report E-2023100278
item.description:
Report E-2023100278

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one case of marshal 25 EC (un2991) damaging one of the inner poly 1 gallon jug and releasing 1 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023100190
item.description:
Report E-2023100190

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 55 gallon drum of acetone (un1090) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 10 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report I-2023090134
item.description:
Report I-2023090134

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-03
  • City: Albany
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HERITAGE TRANSPORT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 10:00 Sunday 09/03/23, a Heritage Transport employee contacted the facility Manager of the Heritage Albany 10-day to let him know there was a Leaking container on a staged trailer. The facility manager unloaded the trailer and identified the container, an FIBC. Approximately lgal of liquid leaked from the FIBC. The. leak was absorbed using absorbent pads and granular absorbent. The FIBC was 6verpacked into a new FIBC. The absorbent material was packaged for transport/ disposal.
